Description: Textile fragment; lower half of one side of undyed linen tunic; vertical side-seam joining two selvedges; twisted warp fringe preceded by triple self-band; stained with resin or bitumen from re-use on mummy. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.29 ends per 10mm and weft 10 picks per 10mm. The two plain selvedges are probably the same one folded back on itself - i.e. the two fringes are two ends of the same cloth. They include warp fringes without knots, each two threads Z-plied then S-twisted with neighbouring pair. The seam is oversewn/top sewn with S-spun, z-plied linen thread; darning thread ditto - all the darning lines of hitches are parallel to the warp holding and grouping the weft.
Dimensions: Width: 36 centimetres (if folded at side seam)
